titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wilmot and Andrews ledgers 1985.023
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:48:32 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection consists of two ledgers which belonged to Wilmot and Andrews, each containing lists of daily sales and expenditures dating from 1839-1915.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Wilmot and Andrews owned a general store and possibly owned rental houses in New York City in the 19th and early 20th centuries.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition unknown. Ledgers accessioned in 1985.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Wilmot and Andrews ledgers, 1985.023, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ledgers are in the public domain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two ledgers which belonged to Wilmot and Andrews, each containing lists of daily sales and expenditures dating from 1839-1915. Sales include provisions for families and ships, such as meat, fish, sugar, bread, produce, dairy products, and other goods. Wilmot and Andrews conducted business in New York City.
